messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Books on Samurai familys
messages.msgSnippet: In English for Tokugawa Ieyasu there are two biographies by A. L Sadler (very old but worth reading) and Conrad Totman (newer but shorter). For Uesugi Kenshin,
messages.messageBody:
In English for Tokugawa Ieyasu there are two biographies by A. L Sadler
(very old but worth reading) and Conrad Totman (newer but shorter). For
Uesugi Kenshin, Takeda Shingen, as well as II Naomasa Daisho publishing had
some short booklets(about 30 to 40 pages), In Japanese there are enought
books to pave an airport runway. I would suggest the Rekishi Gunzo series,
the latest is on Akechi Mitsuhide.
----- Original Message -----
From: squrpio_prince <squrpio_prince@...>
To: <samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, July 26, 2002 6:16 AM
Subject: [samuraihistory] Books on Samurai familys


> Are there any books that are based on a single family or man like
> Uesigi Kenshin, Tokugawa,Ect.?Except for Hideyoshi because I have
> read his books.
>
>
> Ryan
>

messages.subject: Books on Samurai familys
messages.msgSnippet: Are there any books that are based on a single family or man like Uesigi Kenshin, Tokugawa,Ect.?Except for Hideyoshi because I have read his books. Ryan
messages.messageBody:
Are there any books that are based on a single family or man like
Uesigi Kenshin, Tokugawa,Ect.?Except for Hideyoshi because I have
read his books.


Ryan
